sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: This is Euronews Now. I'm Helena Humphrey. Here are your headlines.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Ukraine says nine Russian warplanes were destroyed in the Crimea blasts, but has not claimed responsibility for the explosions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Dozens of people are still missing after a migrant boat sinks off the coast of Greece.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: missing after a migrant boat sinks off the coast of Greece.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And as another heat wave grips Europe, thousands are evacuated from their homes in France as another wave of wildfires ravage forests.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Residents of the Ukrainian city of Maganets are counting the cost of the latest round of Russian shelling.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: At least 13 people died in the strike.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Kiev claims the rockets were fired from the territory of the Zaporizhia nuclear power plant, which lies just across the Dnipro River.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Russian troops control the plant and have been accused by Ukraine of turning it into a military base from which to fire missiles, knowing it's too risky for Ukraine to fire back.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: There have been numerous skirmishes near the atomic plant, where several shells have already fallen, putting the international community on edge, fearing a nuclear catastrophe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Russia blames Ukraine and has requested today's urgent meeting of the UN Security Council in New York to discuss the situation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: At the same time, G7 nations have demanded that Russia must immediately hand back control of the Zaporizhia nuclear power plant to Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: They accuse Moscow's forces of putting the entire region in danger.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Earlier this week, a Ukrainian military official said safety at the plant couldn't be guaranteed because there are armed Russians there overseeing Ukrainian technicians, but the power plant units themselves are generally protected.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: On another front, there is growing pressure on Europe to ban Russian tourists.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Echoing his president, Ukraine's foreign minister tweeted he wants international bodies to stop issuing visas to Russians.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Visiting Europe is a privilege, not a human right for holidaymakers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, more Russian shelling in the country's north-east has left two people dead in the village of Starysoltiv in the Kharkiv region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Finnish Defence Forces are engaged in joint exercises with the US Navy just days after the Senate in Washington voted near unanimously to ratify Finland and Sweden joining NATO.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Even though Finland has practised with NATO for the last 30 years, joint drills have been stepped up following Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It's the first time the USS Kursarj has been in Finnish waters.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The task of coordinating troops and weaponry is one of the big challenges of Finland's NATO membership.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: This week Polish troops are training on American-made Abrams tanks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Poland is contracted to buy 250 of them in a stated move to strengthen its armed forces in light of what it calls a Russian threat.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The last NATO summit its secretary general, Jens Stoltenberg, said the alliance faces a new security reality and it needed to reset its deterrence and defence for the longer term.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: An emphasis on equipping and training appears to be part of that reset.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It's now feared dozens of people have died off the coast of Greece after their boat sank while attempting to cross the Mediterranean.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: An air and sea rescue operation that began Wednesday morning managed to pick up 29 people after their vessel sank in stormy waters.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The tragedy happened after the boat left Turkey on Tuesday night.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The boat was en route to Italy from Antalya in southern Turkey, an increasingly popular passage for those attempting to get to Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The people rescued from the waters are said to be Afghan, Iranian and Iraqi nationals, according to one official.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: No one on board was reportedly wearing a life jacket.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Since January, 64 people have died in the eastern Mediterranean, and eight people died off the Greek island of Mykonos on June 19, and 108 more were rescued.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: A huge wildfire that has destroyed more than a dozen homes and forced the evacuation of thousands of residents is sweeping through the Gironne region of southwestern France.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Authorities believe the latest inferno is the result of so-called zombie fires, a former blaze which lies smoldering in peaty soil and then flares up again.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: blaze which lies smoldering in peaty soil and then flares up again.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It's likely that the fire spread underground and then started again in areas that were still green and at that point the fire, also because of the dryness of the vegetation and the extremely low humidity, started again very quickly and re-inflamed the pines. Around 1,000 firefighters are tackling the fire which has ravaged 6,000 hectares of pine forests since Tuesday afternoon.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The sweltering temperatures sweeping Europe and the accompanying lack of rain are affecting major rivers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Officials in Germany are warning that water levels on the Rhine River could reach a critical low in the coming days.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It will make the transport of goods along the river, including coal and gasoline, increasingly difficult.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And in England, where the health warning due to the heat has been issued, it now seems the official source of the River Thames has dried up. The driest start to a year in decades has shifted the source of this English river several miles downstream, leaving scorched earth and the occasional puddle where water once flowed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Germany has been hit by a severe drought all across the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Germany has been hit by a severe drought all across the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Here in Berlin, several lakes have reached a critical water level to the point where even the river Spree, this big river that is flowing through the capital city, is flowing in the wrong direction at certain parts, flowing back into these lakes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: But it's obviously not just a problem here around Berlin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: It is a problem in other parts of the country as well.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The mighty river Rhine that cuts through the country has almost dried out at certain places.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And this is becoming a problem for the German industry.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: A lot of cargo is still shipped along this river.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And the cargo ships just simply can't operate at the level that they normally would. Most cargo ships can now only take 30 percent of the amount of cargo that they would normally take because the river is simply so shallow at places that they can't travel on it with the normal load. And that is becoming a problem for the German industry, an industry that has already been hit by the corona crisis and by the Russian invasion of Ukraine and now hit by a drought.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Jonah Kalgrin, Euronews, Berlin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Germany wants to raise income tax thresholds in response to the highest inflation in the country in decades.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: As residents feel the pinch from soaring food and energy prices, electricity and more, the finance ministry says it will also slightly increase child benefits, hoping to provide some relief after the 8.5% inflation hike last month.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: For many people, everyday life has become far too expensive.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We fear that gas, energy and food prices will rise.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: At the same time, our country's economic prospects have become fragile and forecasts for economic growth have to be revised downwards.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: We are therefore in a position where action is needed." In Scandinavia, prices of goods and services in Denmark have increased by an average of 13.2% in the past year, the highest annual increase since 1982.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: year, the highest annual increase since 1982. Norway's July figures have marked a historically high price increase for food and non-alcoholic beverages.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: But there's better news from the other side of the Atlantic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: US President Joe Biden says inflation is showing signs of moderating, but more work is needed to make consumers' lives easier.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It is well on track due to the bond process.
